subject: assertNotEquals and assertThrows
msgSnippet: Hi JUnit Guys, I ve been using junit for a while now. These days every piece of java snippet I write has a test attached to it :). I was wondering why there
messageBody:
Hi JUnit Guys,

I've been using junit for a while now. These days every piece of java
snippet I write has a test attached to it :).

I was wondering why there are no assertNotEquals and assertThrows methods in
the Assert class. I have needed something like this many times in my
testing, and have had to fall back to doing assertFalse(a.equals(b)) and a
sequence of try-catch-fail, respectively.

assertNotEquals seems trivial to me, and assertThrows, in my thougths would
take the exception being expected, or default to Exception.

Just wondering if these have come up before, and what the thoughts on them
are. If needed, I can try coding them up and get on the developer list.

Thanks,
- Nitay.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
